sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"温和的，柔和的"之意。
means: gentle ： 指温柔、亲切、优雅。常含有节制和意味。
mild ： 用于人时，指天性温顺，脾气好，不放肆粗野；用于物时，主要指适度，程度上相当缓和给人以愉快感觉。
soft ： 侧重柔软或安稳、光滑，使人不感到粗糙或严酷。
tender和gentle意思很接近。指人的感情细腻、温情慈爱和有同情心，侧重心理素质。也可指物的柔嫩等。
moderate ： 中性词，指温和稳健，有节制，不走极端。

word_mean: 为军、民船舶或近海设施提供维修勤务或供应物资、器材的船。

sentence.Network_en: Steam the carrots until they are just beginning to be tender.
sentence.Network_cn: 将胡萝卜蒸至刚好变软。

sentence.Network_en: The staff are forbidden to tender for private-sector work.
sentence.Network_cn: 工作人员不得投标承接私营部门的工作。

sentence.Network_en: If the meat is marbled with fat it should be tender.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果是五花肉的话，应该比较嫩。

jx.jx_en_mean: used ironically to imply that someone cannot be trusted to look after or treat someone else kindly or well

lj.lj_ly: they have abandoned their children to the tender mercies of the social services.
lj.lj_ls: 他们遗弃了孩子，任其在社会福利中听天由命。

jx.jx_en_mean: seek offers to carry out work or supply goods at a stated fixed price

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French tendre, from Latin tener 'tender, delicate'

mid 16th cent. (as a legal term meaning 'formally offer a plea or evidence, or money to discharge a debt', also as a noun denoting such an offer): from Old French tendre, from Latin tendere 'to stretch, hold forth' (see tend)
late Middle English (in the sense 'attendant, nurse'): from tend or shortening of attender (see attend)

entry.tran: 温柔的;慈爱的;体贴的;柔软的
entry.def: Someone or something that is tender expresses gentle and caring feelings.

example.ex: Her voice was tender, full of pity...
example.tran: 她的声音很温柔，充满了怜爱。

example.ex: Patients may not receive the tender, loving care once associated with a hospital stay.
example.tran: 病人们可能享受不到以前住院时那种悉心体贴的照顾。

entry.def: If you say that someone does something at a tender age, you mean that they do it when they are still young and have not had much experience.

example.ex: He had become attracted to the game at the tender age of seven.
example.tran: 他在7岁的小小年纪就喜欢上了这项运动。

example.ex: ...the loss of her father at such a tender age.
example.tran: 如此幼小的年纪就失去了父亲

entry.tran: (肉等食品)软的，嫩的，易咀嚼的
entry.def: Meat or other food that is tender is easy to cut or chew.

example.ex: Cook for a minimum of 2 hours, or until the meat is tender.
example.tran: 至少煮两个小时，或一直煮到肉变烂为止。

entry.tran: （身体部位）敏感的，疼痛的，一碰就疼的
entry.def: If part of your body is tender, it is sensitive and painful when it is touched.

example.ex: Treat any tender points by massaging.
example.tran: 用按摩法治疗疼痛部位。

entry.def: A tender is a formal offer to supply goods or to do a particular job, and a statement of the price that you or your company will charge. If a contract is put out to tender, formal offers are invited. If a company wins a tender, their offer is accepted.

example.ex: Builders will then be sent the specifications and asked to submit a tender for the work...
example.tran: 建筑商们将会收到说明书，并被邀请参与该项目投标。

example.ex: Some services are now compulsorily put out to tender.
example.tran: 现在，有些服务项目必须进行招标。

entry.def: If a company tenders for something, it makes a formal offer to supply goods or do a job for a particular price.

example.ex: The staff are forbidden to tender for private-sector work...
example.tran: 工作人员不得投标承接私营部门的工作。

example.ex: He tendered for and was awarded the contract.
example.tran: 他参与竞标，并赢得了合同。

entry.def: If you tender something such as a suggestion, your resignation, or money, you formally offer or present it.

example.ex: He took his wallet from his inside coat pocket and tendered the permit.
example.tran: 他从外套内兜里掏出钱包，出示了许可证。

means.word_mean: 1. something used as an official medium of payment
2. someone who waits on or tends to or attends to the needs of another
3. a formal proposal to buy at a specified price
4. car attached to a locomotive to carry fuel and water
5. a boat for communication between ship and shore
6. ship that usually provides supplies to other ships
1. offer or present for acceptance
2. propose a payment;

sentences.sentence: "The Swiss dealer offered $2 million for the painting"

means.word_mean: 3. make a tender of; in legal settlements
4. make tender or more tender as by marinating, pounding, or applying a tenderizer;
1. given to sympathy or gentleness or sentimentality;
2. hurting;
3. susceptible to physical or emotional injury;
4. having or displaying warmth or affection;
5. easy to cut or chew;
6. physically untoughened;
7. (used of boats) inclined to heel over easily under sail
8. (of plants) not hardy; easily killed by adverse growing condition;

auth_sentence.res_content: For the final act Fenda shows his tender side.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图

stems_affixes.value_cn: 嫩的, 温柔的, 软弱的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向+er→像伸出的幼芽→嫩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
stems_affixes.word_buile: attend[v.出席,参加]+ance表名词→n.出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
attend[v.出席,参加]+ant人→n.服务员;随从,随员
intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图
tend趋向+ency表名词→n.趋势,趋向;倾向
at加强+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→出席
con一起+tend伸展,趋向→一起伸展→竞争,斗争

stems_affixes.value_cn: 延长,延伸;扩充;给予;提供;估价
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→扩张
in内+tend伸展,趋向→内心伸出→想要

stems_affixes.value_cn: 假装,假托,借口,[在演戏中]装扮
stems_affixes.word_buile: pre预先,提前+tend伸展,趋向→提前展开,事先展开→假装,借口
pro前+tend伸展,趋向→v.[使]伸出, [使]伸展

stems_affixes.value_cn: 趋向,往往是;易于,往往会;照料,看护
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向→趋向做→易于,往往会

Sentence.sentence: Most young boys have been trained to believe that men who show tender feelings are considered to be feminine and weak.

means.word_mean: 提出

sentences.en: He tendered the committee a referendum.
sentences.cn: 他向该委员会提交了一份备忘录。

means.word_mean: 【法律】清偿，偿债

sentences.en: The borrower may tender payment of all principal and interest outstanding .
sentences.cn: 借贷者可以清偿全部本金和利息

sentences.en: The borrower may tender payment of all principal and interest outstanding .
sentences.cn: 借贷者可以清偿全部本金和利息

means.word_mean: 脆弱的; 幼弱的; 嫩的

sentences.en: Her skin is very tender, like a baby's.
sentences.cn: 她的皮肤像婴儿一样的柔嫩。

means.word_mean: 温柔的; 亲切的

sentences.en: She spoke tender words to the child.
sentences.cn: 她对那孩子说了些亲切的话。

means.word_mean: 疼痛的, 一触即痛的; 敏感的

sentences.en: You should avoid the tender subject.
sentences.cn: 你们应当避开这个令人不快的话题。

jushi.english: Passengers should tender the exact fare.Change will not be given on this bus.
jushi.chinese: 乘客须付正好的车费,本车一律不设找赎。

jushi.english: I wish to tender him my thanks for his kindness.
jushi.chinese: 我想对他的一片好意表示感谢。
